tables.table_schema:
CREATE TABLE compliance_policies_procedures (
  policy_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  policy_name VARCHAR(255),
  policy_description TEXT,
  policy_owner VARCHAR(100),
  creation_date TIMESTAMP
)

CREATE TABLE policy_procedure_mapping (
	mapping_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
	policy_id INT,
	procedure_id INT,
	FOREIGN KEY (policy_id) REFERENCES compliance_policies(policy_id),
	FOREIGN KEY (procedure_id) REFERENCES procedures(procedure_id)
);

CREATE TABLE policy_links (
    link_id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
    policy_id INT NOT NULL,
    standard_id INT NOT NULL,
    FOREIGN KEY (policy_id) REFERENCES compliance_policies_and_procedures(policy_id),
    FOREIGN KEY (standard_id) REFERENCES industry_standards(standard_id)
);

CREATE TABLE document_history (
    document_id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
    document_name VARCHAR(255) NOT NULL,
    policy_id INT NOT NULL,
    date_modified TIMESTAMP NOT NULL,
    FOREIGN KEY (policy_id) REFERENCES compliance_policies_and_procedures(policy_id)
);

CREATE TABLE procedures (
    id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    procedure_name VARCHAR(255),
    procedure_details TEXT,
    policy_id INT,
    FOREIGN KEY (policy_id) REFERENCES compliance_policies(id)
);

CREATE TABLE policy_mapping (
    id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    policy_id INT,
    standard_id INT,
    FOREIGN KEY (policy_id) REFERENCES compliance_policies(id),
    FOREIGN KEY (standard_id) REFERENCES industry_standards(id)
);

CREATE TABLE employee_compliance (
    id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    employee_id INT,
    policy_id INT,
    status VARCHAR(50),
    FOREIGN KEY (employee_id) REFERENCES employees(id),
    FOREIGN KEY (policy_id) REFERENCES compliance_policies(id)
);
